metadata.title: CVE-2019-8942 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 4.9.9 and 5.x before 5.0.1 allows remote code executionbecause an _wp_attached_file Post Meta entry can be changed to an arbitrarystring, such as one ending with a .jpg?file.php substring. An attacker withauthor privileges can execute arbitrary code by uploading a crafted imagecontaining PHP code in the Exif metadata. Exploitation can leverageCVE-2019-8943.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.0.3+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.0.3+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.0.3+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.0.3+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentytwo - 5.0.3+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.3+dfsg1-1').
